Very good game stranger thing is my favorite pack

this game is marketed essentially as some kind of asymmetrical horror game where you chase down and murder people.

what you actually do is 'loop' around the same terrain feature several times chasing people until either person gets bored or makes a mistake while on the other side of the map people are finishing generators and you lose.
if you decide to try a different character to utilise their unique abilities to have more fun, well be prepared to cough up at least $5 for it or commit to playing this snooze fest for a long time to unlock them with in-game currency.

I'm aware many people enjoy this game and I'm sure they have their reasons but its a glorified game of tag. not a 'survival horror' game.  You could go outside with friends and enjoy the exact same experience, so I can't recommend you pay $20+ for this.

I have a library of over 120 games across numerous genres and platforms. Dead by Daylight reminds me with every session just how poorly crafted and inferior it is to all other games. This game is horrendous, and I will gladly elaborate. 

I cannot describe how infuriatingly unfair this game is. For those who are completely unfamiliar with the game, good for you! Essentially, 4 survivors and 1 killer are put in a map with the survivors' goal being to find and start 5 generators around the map to open the door and escape. Need I elaborate on the killer's objective.

Well guess what? To make a balanced and fun game, they made EVERY killer. EVERY SINGLE ONE. Faster than survivors (most by default, one killer needs to use an ability). What does this mean? If the killer sees you, you are going to go down and get hooked. It is inevitable. Even if you spend hours in the game, stack as many top-tier perks and rare loot as you can, level your favorite characters, none of these accomplishments can do more than delay the inevitable. No matter how skilled you are, or how many items you have at your disposal, you are going to go down if you get seen (provided the killer isn't wholly incompetent).

You might say "oh, well just don't get seen". That's a swell idea. However, maps are small enough to see all the ends from the middle. Killers have MULTIPLE perks that allow them to see locations of players, and if you SPRINT, VAULT, HIDE, MISS A SKILL CHECK, or are already INJURED, the killer can track you or just get immediate information as to where you are. To simplify, Do Anything = Get Found. Oh, and some killers can teleport to you. If that wasn't enough, the killer can actively see EVERY incomplete generator. So he knows at ALL times, EVERY possible objective you have left to do. A simple patrol between these generators, especially late game when the number of incomplete generators is decreasing, will pretty handily uncover remaining survivors.

Survivors, then, unable to effectively hide, unable to flee, and unable to complete objectives effectively (which, by the way, take forever, and involve skill checks that can, luck of the draw, be near-impossible to pass), cannot even resort to any sort of retaliation. You cannot hurt the killer or cause him any amount of permanent damage or even inconvenience. At MOST, with a perfectly-timed flashlight beam, trap, or perk of some kind, a survivor can stun the killer for a few short seconds, only delaying the inevitable for a short time. Survivors are helpless and weak. For some reason, the already-handicapped survivors are discouraged from camping, either from necessity (completing objectives or freeing teammates) or for fear of having their positions revealed. But FOR SOME REASON, killers have ZERO balances against camping. They can camp generators, or your injured teammates, with NO consequences. 

Dead by Daylight is a game that is WILDLY unbalanced in favor of the killer. And if you're thinking of playing Killer to have this utopious, carefree fun time, think again; it takes several minutes, 5-8, to find a match playing as a Survivor. Now recall, there are 4 Survivors to every 1 Killer. This means if you want to play Killer, be prepared to wait upwards of 10-15 minutes between every match. Who wants to wait that long just to dominate every match with ease? All it takes is employing the ever-elusive Common Sense, and victory is only 4 kills away.

In conclusion, I would not recommend this game to anyone. If you are dead set on getting this game for whatever reason, be prepared to die almost every round; be prepared to not have any countermeasures to the overwhelming power of the killer. You will only win Trials in which you or your teammates ran around the map "looping" the Killer the whole time, sacrificing your frail character for those few precious seconds of extra life after the killer has seen you. That's what it means to be a good Survivor player in DbD-- being good at running away from something you cannot fight, and something that will ALWAYS, 100% of the time, catch you eventually. 

This game is unbalanced, and therefore non-competitive and not very fun. Poor game design.

Quando vc eh killer e joga contra um time fechado vc pode ficar put* pois a partida acaba em 4 min pois os geradores acabam muito rapido entao eu vou recomendar so pq eu tenho quase 1k de horas.
